title: Ticket #4625: Default configuration file for chirp has wrong name.
description:
In jic_shadow.cpp, the following line 

const char* CHIRP_CONFIG_FILENAME = ".chirp_config";

should probably be 

const char* CHIRP_CONFIG_FILENAME = ".chirp.config";

to be consistent with the rest of the chirp code. This causes Metronome grief (although it's easily worked around) because it was clearing all but a few _CONDOR variables from environment to prevent them screwing up the configuration of the HTCondor it was launching.
remarks:
2014-Sep-29 17:53:12 by tlmiller:
Brian, you were cc'd on the off the chance that this was for some reason deliberate (or that the underscore is correct and the dot is wrong).

2014-Sep-29 19:40:01 by bbockelm:
Looking through old notes (and the comments in the CCTools chirp client), I think the original intent was ".chirp.config".
